intro: Baccaurea pynaertii, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fruits that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough or hairy texture. The flowers are small and clustered, with both male and female flowers occurring on the same plant.
